items.content:
Recruiting and Talent Lead at Tidelift

Remote | Entry-level
  • People Operations
  • Boston, MA or remote

What were building
At Tidelift, our mission is making open source software work betterfor everyone. We see a world where open source creators can get paid for doing work they love, and software development teams get software they can depend on. Were already supporting many of the most important projects in open source, and adding more all the time.

We’re still small, but well-funded and growing. You will be able to play a large role in tackling challenging problems and helping build the company, while learning alongside our experienced team.

How you can help

We’re looking for a Recruiting and Talent Lead to build the recruiting programs for Tidelift. As our first dedicated People Operations team member, you will help build an effective, diverse, values-driven team.

You will own our recruiting efforts from beginning to end, including:

  • Work with teams and hiring managers to define roles, and build structured interview materials that help us identify the best candidates (not just the ones who mirror our own biases)
  • Refine and implement our recruiting process, including finding diverse candidates, scheduling interviews, and managing evaluations (screening, internal, and references), and ensuring were using appropriate tooling. (We currently use Google Hire but are open to candidates with other preferences/experience.)
  • Drive the candidate and new employee experience. We consider user experience critical to everything we do, including how we bring people into the company, from the first time they read our job description to the time theyre fully onboarded. Youll help us make that happen in partnership with internal and external resources.
  • Support culture in a time of growth: we plan to more than double in size in 2019. This role will advise and support the leadership team to ensure our culture stays healthy and supportive through that transition.

Prior experience with people operations at a growing startup is a plus, but were open to a candidate who is excited to recruit and can grow into a broader people operations role.

This team

You will be the first hire in our People Ops team. You will collaborate with an experienced leadership team that has seen and managed explosive growth at HubSpot, Red Hat, Wikipedia, and a wide variety of other startups. The role will report to a co-founder, and will also work closely with our head of marketing, who led Red Hats efforts to ensure that the brand and culture were closely intertwined.

Our values

Were trying to build a healthy, values-driven culture. We want to be:

  • Optimistic: We see an amazing future ahead, and want to inspire others to share in it. This is both internalbuilding each other up and looking for the best in peopleand externalwe know open source is awesome, and we want to make it even better.
  • Practical: We know words and ideas alone wont change lives. We help people most by creating a pragmatic, viable, and sustainable business that works for everyone. So we care about usability, design, and honest assessment of costs and benefits.
  • Additive: We want an environment that encourages and inspires growth, both for individuals and for the open source community as a whole. That means embracing a growth mindset, and valuing culture add over culture fit.
  • Inclusive: We believe technology will be stronger when it better reflects the voices and ideas of society as a whole. So we want people from different backgrounds and experiences to not just be represented, but to be heard, valued, and flourish. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

How we work

  • In this role, you can work remotely (within the US) or from our office in downtown Boston. About half of our team, including two of our founders, are remote, and we take employee experience seriously wherever you are based.
  • We believe in the urgency of our mission, and the importance of doing good work, but also know this is a marathon and not a sprint. Hours can be flexible within reason if necessary to meet personal needs (like child, medical, or elder care).

Compensation, benefits, and career

  • Compensation is competitive with other Boston-area startups, including key benefits like health insurance, flexible vacation, 401(k), parental leave, and equity.
  • We are invested in every employees growth, and support professional development that aligns with your goals and how you learn best.

How to apply

  • Fill out the form below. We’d love it if you add a thoughtful note about your goals and your background. Well get back to you promptly!
  • Please note that we are not looking to hire contractors or outsourced development teams.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90+ people is growing fast. Our team has an immediate full-time opening for an enthusiastic and experienced Recruiter who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

*This is a full-time remote position based in the US only.

As a Recruiter at TaxJar you will:

  • Collaborate with hiring managers on a regular basis and proactively identify future hiring needs.
  • Attract candidates using various sources, such as social media networks and other creative ways to attract new talent!
  • Ideally hold an academic HR background combined with work experience in screening, interviewing and assessing candidates.

You will join our Employee Experience team. Your role will be to help shape the future of TaxJar by working with our Lead Recruiter to assist within the full-lifecycle recruiting process.   • Provide analytical and well-documented recruiting reports to the rest of the team
  • Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process

We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

DESCRIPTION

MVP Factory delivers the best software in the market. We enable companies of all sizes to efficiently design, test, build and scale top technology products.

We’re now looking for a Talent Acquisition Manager to help us achieve our ambitious growth plans. We’ve experienced some rapid success and are looking for someone to help us craft and develop our Talent Acquisition operation.

We are tech agnostic and hand curate cross-functional teams to execute our client projects, meaning we need flexible and dynamic hiring strategies to effectively deal with demand.

This person would ideally understand & have a passion for product, with a firm understanding of both start-up and corporate ecosystems alike. You are a self-starter and are always looking for ways to innovate your practice and challenge ‘standard’ ways of doing things.

THE ROLE:

  • Identification, engagement and recruitment of the best talent in the market across Software Development, Product Management, Project Management and UX/UI – both freelance and fulltime.
  • Develop and own end-to-end process management, ensuring all candidates have a great experience throughout, irrespective of the outcome.
  • Work alongside management to build authentic employer branding, driving consistent inbound interest from the best profiles across our key markets.
  • Work with marketing to proactively spot content & event opportunities to drive our reputation forward as a key player in the digital landscape

YOUR PROFILE:

  • You have solid experience recruiting for technical positions across development, product & UX/UI – your knowledge allows you to quickly determine a truly skilled candidate without relying on ‘keywords’ or script-like questioning.
  • You understand the competitive nature of the market and have developed your own approach to address this.
  • You’re interested in what you’re building – as the first point of contact to potential talent, you’re able to properly articulate the mission because you’re passionate about what you do. You stay on top of the latest developments in the tech industry and spend time to really understand the fundamentals of the projects you need to recruit for.
  • You have excellent knowledge of the various sourcing channels and are constantly looking for ways to ‘hack’ the traditional methods of talent identification. Your approach is personal and makes you stand out from the generic ‘spam’ approach.
  • You can always be found at a meetup/talk/conference, engaging with the ‘hard to find’ profiles that don’t make themselves known elsewhere.
  • Above everything else, you are a people person – you care about engaging talent for the right reasons and spend the time getting to know what someone’s key drivers are before ‘selling’ to them.

WHY US?

  • Competitive salary
  • Being part of MVPF enables you to build a network of companies and people all over the world and share knowledge with the best entrepreneurs, designers and developers in the industry
  • We embrace remote work and allow our employees to work remotely whenever possible.
  • Amazing views over Berlin in our 29th Floor office, right next to the river!
  • Access to the best resources – whatever you need to do your job the best way possible

ABOUT SIDE

At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.

As the first company to design an end to end modern brokerage solution, Side is re-imagining the real estate industry from the ground up by combining innovative technology, creative branding expertise, and an experienced leadership team with a mission to empower the world’s leading real estate professionals to own their brand and better serve home buyers and sellers.

In the past two years, with an exceptional team of inSiders, we’ve processed $1B in transactions and raised over $30M in funding from top tier investors like Matrix Partners, Trinity Ventures, and 8VC.

At Side, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you’ll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We’re a growing team of Talent Specialists and we’re instrumental to the direct growth of the company. We touch every department, and our hiring managers see us as hiring experts and partner closely with us to scale the company with the right talent in the right roles.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for a full-cycle (remote contractor) Recruiter to own a mixture of business and technical hiring. As a full-cycle recruiter, you’ll be responsible for developing and implementing a candidate recruitment strategy. This includes advertising and passive candidate sourcing, acting as the gatekeeper to our culture and screening candidates thoroughly before passing them onto the next round, and creating a superb candidate experience that promotes our employer brand. You’ll own the recruitment of 8-10 roles at a time and manage the relationships with each candidate.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

  • Lead intake discussions with hiring managers, gathering the role requirements and supporting hiring managers in defining the interview process
  • Develop and implement advertising strategies to attract candidates to each role that you own
  • Source potential candidates on major and niche platforms by crafting personalized recruiting emails
  • Phone screen candidates and assess for cultural and role fit, make recommendations to hiring managers on which candidates to move forward with
  • Own candidate relationships and maintain a high close rate per requisition

WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE?

  • 5+ years of experience in the recruiting industry with at least 3 years as a full-cycle recruiter
  • Strong writing skills and can succinctly develop a pitch
  • Critical eye for identifying top talent for specific roles
  • Strong prioritization skills
  • Successful track record of achieving targets
  • Candidate-first mentality
  • Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (specifically Lever)
  • Self-starter with an incredible work ethic

Side is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. Side does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, veteran status, or disability status.

Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.

Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

HR Administrator at Human Made

Remote | International

You will be responsible for coordinating the hiring process, so experience with recruitment is desirable including building role profiles and understanding and using recruitment platforms. As Human Made is actively seeking to create a more diverse team, experience with recruiting from minority groups in the tech industry is an advantage. You will draft job descriptions, advertise new roles, triage applications, and follow up with applicants. When a new employee accepts a position, you will be responsible for creating their contract and onboarding them to the company. You should provide input into how to refine and improve Human Made’s recruitment and hiring processes.

Human Made has a number of HR management systems, including CharlieHR and TriNet. You will be responsible for updating these as required and ensuring that they remain compliant with relevant data protection law. The company has a public handbook, which you will be responsible for updating, including HR policies based on the suggestions of our HR advisors in the UK, USA, and Australia. You will be expected to liaise with those advisors on HR-related matters, and to speak to our other legal advisors with regards to issues such as new subsidiaries, insurance, and visa applications.

You will be responsible for administrating Human Made’s HR processes, including engagement surveys, 360s, and Performance Review. You’ll work with the Director of People Operations to roll out new HR and culture initiatives.

Human Made is a visa sponsoring organisation in the UK and Australia. You will be responsible for administering the visa application process for employees who are seeking to move to these countries.

You will be responsible for Human Made’s GDPR compliance, including updating our data protection policies and conducting data protecting audits as necessary. Prior knowledge of this is not required and training will be provided to support you.

Human Made is a remote company so you should have excellent written communication skills that enable you to work with a diverse group of people from around the world. You should be able to work in a self-directed manner, addressing problems as they come up, and identifying issues in your area of work and fixing them. You should be able to prioritise your tasks and able to ask for help when you need it.

As this is a HR role, you should have excellent interpersonal skills and be able to communicate well with people at all levels of the company. You will be a member of the Operations Team, reporting directly to the Director of People (who reports to the CEO).

Responsibilities

  • Assisting with the management of the hiring process, including triaging applications, advertising new roles, following up with applicants.
  • Onboarding new employees.
  • Updating the handbook and HR policies.
  • Liaising with HR advisors in the UK, USA, and Australia.
  • Creating contracts.
  • Liaising with the company’s employment law advisors.
  • Managing the visa sponsorship process and maintaining compliance.
  • Overseeing the company’s data protection compliance (including GDPR).
  • Updating the company’s HR systems.
  • Administrating continuous improvements cycles (360s & performance reviews).
  • Administrating the engagement survey
  • Supporting employee engagement across the company.
  • Promoting our culture and values within our people documents and communications.
  • Collating key people metrics and reporting to the company.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Empathetic and people-focused.
  • Experience with recruitment.
  • Experience with recruiting minorities in the tech industry is an advantage.
  • HR experience in the UK, United States, or Australia.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to understand and communicate legal advice.
  • Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to identify and implement commercial HR solutions.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to juggle multiple tasks and switch contexts.
  • Pro-active about fixing problems where you see them
  • Experience of People Operations or remote work is an advantage.

BENEFITS

  • £25,000 – £30,000 GBP (or local equivalent)
  • Flexible working
  • 52 weeks parental leave
  • 35 days holiday (including public holiday)
  • Sickness and carers leave
  • Annual company retreat (Previous retreats have been in Sri Lanka, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, Norway)
  • Conference and training budget
  • Monthly remote working allowance
  • Work wherever you want

*Please note that although this role is remote, we are only considering candidates within North America*


About You

  • You are a go-getter and love diving into any task - big or small.

  • You're fun! You’re charismatic! And you enjoy research and talking with people. You thrive on fast-paced deadlines, managing complex projects and shocking your team with neat tricks and innovative problem-solving skills.

  • You love social media and community engagement.

  • You're available from 9am-5pm EST and it's a HUGE plus if you have previous experience on a distributed team!

Who We Are

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits that promote personal and professional growth!

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Training Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Executive Recruiter at BSG Team Ventures

Remote | Part-time

Job Code:BSGExecRecr

Virtual Consulting Role for Boutique Retained Executive Search Firm

PART-TIME (15-30 hours /week average)

WHO WE NEED TO GROW OUR TEAM

BSG Team Ventures is growing and looking to add a few talented Recruiting Consultants.

  • What’s involved in that responsibility?
  • We research, target and reach out to potential executives qualified for those roles on which we’re retained.
  • This position is responsible for screening executives who respond to our overtures and qualifying them further by telephone regarding their fit for the search –competencies that are “must-have’s” in a specific role, motivations they have to consider a change, geographic restrictions/relocatable, current compensation details and needs in considering a new career opportunity.

SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED IN ORDER TO BE SUCCESSFUL?

  • Management Consulting, Human Resources experience with Talent/Recruiting is a big part of the role, as well as Investigative Reporting. In general, we seek someone with a curiosity around talent acquisition and fit, and those who understand and desire a role that engages with smart successful executives who are looking to better their careers with our help and guidance.
  • As mentioned, the “Investigative Reporter” is also a great characteristic in this role. Someone who is comfortable with asking “why,” probing, and exposing the invisible when it comes to an executive’s drive, motivations, and potential culture fit with a given client.

Does this sound like the opportunity for you? Read on.WHAT ISN’T REQUIRED IN THIS ROLE?

  • This is a virtual role. This is not an in person/office-based environment. Telephone connectivity and good Internet broadband speed are critical, however.
  • Prior executive search recruiting experience? While it’s a great “nice-to-have,” we have had great success hiring from a number of backgrounds as noted above.

WHAT BSG TEAM VENTURES PROVIDES?

  • Training on our specific process and methodology, cloud-based project management and candidate management system, and other necessary infrastructure.

TIME REQUIREMENTS:

  • We need a minimum of 15 hours a week. While hours flex, maximum is typically 25-30 hours in any given week.
  • Note that most of this position’s time is spent in half-hour candidate discovery and screening calls, so availability both during work hours and some after-hours can be important.

COMPENSATION:

  • Compensation is on an hourly basis, and commensurate with a consultant’s experience and skills.

WHO WE ARE?

BSG Team Ventures was founded in 1997 as Boston Search Group and rebranded in 2008. We’re a professional services firm, focused on retained executive search, recruiting leaders for rapidly changing environments

WHO ARE OUR CLIENTS?

BSG Team Ventures serves a wide range of clients, including public corporations and not-for-profit organizations. However, the greatest concentration of BSG’s work is with private equity firms and their portfolio companies to expand or upgrade management, and with venture capital firms and entrepreneurs to build teams for early-stage businesses. We build executive teams for investor-backed businesses–middle market private equity, lower-middle market growth equity, and venture capital backed in industries spanning the manufacturing, services, technology, restaurant, and energy sectors. Over the past 20 years, BSG principals – working from offices in Boston, San Francisco, and London – have completed more than 500 assignments for board directors, C-level executives, and VPs in every major functional area.

For more information or to submit your resume, please click on the “Apply For This Position” tab at the top of this page.
